p: In northeast Brazil, the models predict a future increase in climatic suitability for L. intermedia mainly in central Piauí state. This is a region of transition between the Cerrado and Caatinga biomes, which are substantially drier and warmer than the Atlantic Forest where L. intermedia currently occurs [ 9]. This region is poorly sampled for sand flies. However, captures performed in the late 1990s detected only L. longipalpis and L. whitmani as potential vector species [ 69]. There is a single record of L. intermedia in Piauí State, in the capital Teresina [ 13, 28]. Future field studies should survey this area for the occurrence of L. intermedia and other potential vectors.
